I've learnt this unisex fragrance is has been discontinued so thought one of you may be interested? My grandfather had them but he has passed away. Drop me message if you are interested</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="1368329"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=1368329#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1355782" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1355782" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jrawblue24"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1338005"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1338005.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jrawblue24" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1355782ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1355782" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1338005">Jrawblue24</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-06">06/06/21 21:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have a 100ml bottle with about 80% juice that I am willing to trade or sell. For me... I like lavender for body wash or aromatherapy. If it’s not too prominent, I can deal with it in fragrances. This is a total scrubber for me... it’s ok as it dries down, but the opening is disgustingly green.. actually reminiscent of a cold day stranded in the jungle (if that’s possible), while entangled in thorny bush and vines, while also staring at a jaguars piercing amber eyes. Again the dry down is pretty pleasant, but should ONLY be worn if, when leaving your favorite barbershop, your barber forgets to brush you with talcum powder</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="1355782"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=1355782#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1335258" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1335258" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tree trunk over load"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1333439"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tree trunk over load" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1335258ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1335258" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1333439">Tree trunk over load</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-30">04/30/21 17:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Got it last summer. So this is my unpleasant memory of Covid quarantine time. Pm me if you’re interested in owning the remaining 90ml ish left with the box. (WA, USA)<br />
—————— Actual Review ———————<br />
<br />
The opening is very sharp. Feels dark green to me. Need to wake up early? Spray this once the alarm clock goes off and take a sniff. <br />
<br />
The middle notes smells somewhat bitter or medicine like? Try chewing english ivy, pretty similar. Feels like a navy blue mixed dark green. <br />
<br />
The base notes lasted for quite a long time. Feels like the color dark grey. It’s somewhat clean and soapy. <br />
<br />
Overall english fern appears to me like a dude who does not smiles at all, very serious on whatever his job is, but secretly worries about armpit sweating.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="1335258"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=1335258#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1305192" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1305192" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Glyph"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1312716"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1312716.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Glyph" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Givenchy/Xeryus-861.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.861.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Xeryus"title="Xeryus"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1305192ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1305192" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1312716">Glyph</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-09">03/09/21 22:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This was my first blind buy because Penhaligon's is such an English institution and "English Fern" sounded so classy. It indeed *is* very classy, but different from what i had expected (which was more of a grotto-like scent). The geranium combined with the lavender and oakmoss gives it the feel of an elegant London barbershop from a hundred years ago. I'm sorry it's been discontinued, and I'm happy I've not used much of my bottle, saving it for special summer days, even though its sillage and longevity are not quite what I'd like.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="1305192"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=1305192#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1205070" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1205070" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="isla rose"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1002477"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1002477.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="isla rose" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jean-Paul-Gaultier/La-Belle-55786.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55786.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Belle"title="La Belle"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1205070ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1205070" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1002477">isla rose</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-07-29">07/29/20 05:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I feel I may be one of the few females reviewing this one. I came here looking for some female feedback so thought I might add my two cents. <br />
<br />
I received Pehhaligon"s English Fern as a gift from my brother and sister-in-law. My brother fell in love with it upon first sniff and probably knew I would appreciate it being a lover of perfumes. Also, I'm sure it was probably sold to them as a unisex fragrance. <br />
<br />
Although I am a lover of classic fragrances, oakmoss-y chypres (I will bravely and happily wear Clinique Aromatics Elixir on an average day 😁) and lavender and geranium notes, this one threw me at first. My initial reaction with first spray was that I thought it was too masculine leaning. It smelled TOO "barbershop".  But I have grown to love this fragrance because of the drydown. Like other reviers have said, it smells clean and soapy and it soothes me somehow. It really softens with wear. Admittedly, this isn't one I wear out of the house often. It is usually an evening, after a bath perfume. It's lovely.<br />
<br />
Others have mentioned that it smells very "English" and I would have to agree.  This is a fragrance for those who love the classics. It IS old fashioned but in the best way possible. It is not an everyday fragrance for me but I get great pleasure out of wearing it and I'm grateful to have it in my collection.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="1205070"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=1205070#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1183090" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1183090" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="GuiltGuild"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1206688"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="GuiltGuild" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfumerie-Particuliere/Madeleine-44201.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.44201.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Madeleine"title="Madeleine"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1183090ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1183090" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1206688">GuiltGuild</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-06-02">06/02/20 00:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I managed to get a 2ml sample last year, which I wore throughout my trip to Ireland, for which a found it to be the perfect companion. Green but not sharp, moist but not calone-aquatic, surprisingly soft and all-in-all magical. I long for a whole bottle, but it's discontinued :((( Impossible to buy one in my country, it seems. And Amazon doesn't ship to my country either.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="1183090"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=1183090#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1170690" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1170690" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Vitriol08"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1215256"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Vitriol08" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/The-Library-Collection-Silver-Oud-69051.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.69051.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Library Collection Silver Oud"title="The Library Collection Silver Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1170690ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1170690" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1215256">Vitriol08</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-05-02">05/02/20 14:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Licorice, anise, ouzo, pastis is what comes to my mind.<br />
With a bit sweetness in the back.<br />
Very pleasant.<br />
Very masculine and mentolated as mentioned.<br />
People say medicinal but i don t smell it as bad, quite the opposite as i find this scent very soothing.<br />
I love it!<br />
Was a blind buy for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="1170690"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=1170690#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1135377" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1135377" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alanwake"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1174422"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1174422.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="alanwake" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mad-et-Len/Paname-40981.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.40981.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Paname"title="Paname"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1135377ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1135377" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1174422">alanwake</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-01-17">01/17/20 11:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This one takes a bit of getting used to. It can come off as sharp and dated, but once you're in tune with its symphony its all smooth sailing. I don't get the Fougere Royale references, this smells nothing like it.  It honestly reminds a lot of Malle's Geranium Monsieur but this is one leans "wet" whereas Malles is "dry" with a more modern edge to it.  Come to think of it: this might even be its predecessor even the notes are similar. It's really all about Lavender, Geranium, clovers, patchouli, nutmeg, oakmoss and sandalwood maybe some rose too. The main highlight of this fragrance is the geranium - freshly squeezed minty mentholated geranium.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="1135377"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=1135377#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1097814" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1097814" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jerry Can"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/785126"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.785126.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jerry Can" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1097814ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1097814" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/785126">Jerry Can</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-09-15">09/15/19 03:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>There are NO cloves in English Fern. The middle note is CLOVER.<br />
<br />
English Fern is a beautiful fougère. Initially there is a curious medicinal air. But that soon passes. For me it's like indulging in a deeply filled hot bath with an expensive soap. Lavender, geranium and clover make for an aura of soapy cleanliness and to me is reminiscent of chamomile. The oakmoss, patchouli and sandalwood add an unintrusive background earthiness. It does feel very Edwardian English.<br />
<br />
Long lasting and having good projection, I'd suggest light application in the first instance. English Fern is described as a scent for men and women. Curious then that the decal should include the words 'after-shave'. There is nothing effeminate here despite its appeal to men and women. Inspires plenty of interest when I wear it. And it isn't hard to discern why — being effortlessly classy even if in a slightly old-fashioned way.<br />
<br />
The longevity alone makes for a good choice as a daytime scent. I've also been known to apply it to my palms before lights-out finding it a perfect way to a good nights sleep.<br />
<br />
Reminds me possibly of D&amp;G Pour Homme, but without the citrus.<br />
<br />
I've heard it rumoured it might be discontinued in 2020. I hope that's wrong. For a composition dating from 1890 to get withdrawn now would be a sort of cultural vandalism.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="1097814"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=1097814#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1079227" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1079227" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="monkey500"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1144035"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1144035.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="monkey500" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Acqua-di-Parma/Essenza-di-Colonia-9829.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9829.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Essenza di Colonia"title="Essenza di Colonia"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1079227ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1079227" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1144035">monkey500</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-07-16">07/16/19 03:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I visited Penhaligon’s in Paris to try some fragrances and unfortunately when I sprayed a sample of this on my skin the immediate reaction of those nearby was, ‘Smells like toilets’ which I can understand because it projects a very strong ‘mentholated green’ smell that reminds me a little of ‘Pine Fresh.’</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="1079227"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=1079227#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1073279" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1073279" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kaurg"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1117052"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="kaurg" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1073279ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1073279" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1117052">kaurg</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-06-26">06/26/19 00:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I do appreciate the fact that this is a piece of fragrance history (and looks like it). Unfortunately, to my nose, it just smells like toothpaste and mentholated joint ointments. More medicinal than everyday-hygiene-related. Very dry and green, thin and ascetic, cold and clean. I wish it had some contrasting base notes to give it more depth, maybe some sweetness to make it more friendly.<br />
<br />
There's no cloves in the composition. It's supposed to be clover. Check the Penhaligon's website. It's strange that so many people get the note that isn't there.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="1073279"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=1073279#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1062954" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1062954" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="chrisk252"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1185528"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="chrisk252" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Cerruti/1881-Men-329.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.329.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="1881 Men"title="1881 Men"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1062954ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1062954" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1185528">chrisk252</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-05-22">05/22/19 08:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Reminded me of a Metropolitan Hotel in Bangkok or traditional Thai houses for some reason. Exotic wood, very green, bit warm, great for lonely Fall walks or Spring walks through the park. 8.5/10.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="1062954"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=1062954#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1043298" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1043298" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tayyabforyouth"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1124219"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1124219.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tayyabforyouth" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Acqua-di-Parma/Colonia-Club-31424.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31424.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Colonia Club"title="Colonia Club"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1043298ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1043298" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1124219">tayyabforyouth</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-03-21">03/21/19 12:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a beautiful gentlemanly mix of lavender, minty geranium, and oakmoss. It smells to my nose like a more minty and fresher version of Houbigant's Fougere Royale (the modern re-issue). It's very simple but really nice to my nose. Longevity and projection are both moderate (could be better but not that bad). Although it's a simple mix, it represents the scent of the quintessential fougere fragrance and I really like it. I have yet to try Trumper's Wild Fern which this is compared to, but I have tried Patrick by Fragrances of Ireland which is a far greener and more earthy take on the fougere than this (this is more about the lavender and geranium). <br />
<br />
4.5/5</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="1043298"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=1043298#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1041595" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1041595" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="zhiang0113"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1173932"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1173932.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="zhiang0113" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bath-Body-Works/Vanilla-Romance-96320.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96320.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanilla Romance"title="Vanilla Romance"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1041595ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1041595" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1173932">zhiang0113</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-03-16">03/16/19 07:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>When I dabbed the sample on my wrist, what struck me was the warm spiciness of ginger and cloves that was reminiscent of the ginger herbal tea that my grandmother used to make. I'm really not a fan of these kinds of scents though. It then dries down into a slightly sweeter, but rather medicinal oakmoss.<br />
<br />
I didn't really get much of the lavender or geranium though, but it could be due to the age of the sample.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="1041595"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=1041595#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1007281" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1007281" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tore"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1174520"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1174520.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tore" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tiziana-Terenzi/Foconero-44358.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.44358.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Foconero"title="Foconero"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1007281ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1007281" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1174520">Tore</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-12-06">12/06/18 07:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ok, this stuff is very green and inspiring, like a walk in a park after the rain. The grass is wet, and the air is so clean and piercing. The geranium is more noticeable than the lavender.<br />
There is something slightly sweet too, maybe some hint of anice, and yes, I feel the cardamome too. The performance is good. 9/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="1007281"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=1007281#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent965306" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc965306" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="echo4kilo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1153785"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1153785.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="echo4kilo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/FZOTIC/Room-237-30364.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.30364.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Room 237"title="Room 237"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma965306ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd965306" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1153785">echo4kilo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-07-25">07/25/18 11:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I got a sample of this from Luckyscent. I really like Penhaligan's Sartorial and wanted to try other fragrances. English Fern has a noticeable licorice smell at first. After a few minutes it has a smell similar to, but inferior to Sartorial under the licorice. I'm glad I only got a sample.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="965306"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=965306#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent879080" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc879080" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mikeyh54"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1095132"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mikeyh54" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Jicky-Eau-de-Parfum-65150.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.65150.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jicky Eau de Parfum"title="Jicky Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma879080ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd879080" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1095132">Mikeyh54</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-11-10">11/10/17 07:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A wonderful history lesson, great lavender and geranium, clover brings a slight hay note, but the base is lacking in the oakmoss and patchouli department for me. In fact, I detect no oakmoss in my bottle whatsoever. This could have been just a stroke of bad luck in getting a transitional formula from the gray market. Luckily, I have oakmoss absolute to layer it with and excited to try. Otherwise, it's a fine morning refresher and pick me up throughout the day. Polite, light, and agreeable. Also, this is quite a natural smelling fragrance. So, that's also a plus. The limited to no oakmoss just doesn't sit well with me. If you buy this from a discounter, be wary.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="879080"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=879080#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent865073" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc865073" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Birnam_Wood"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1061235"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1061235.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Birnam_Wood" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma865073ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd865073" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1061235">Birnam_Wood</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-09-27">09/27/17 01:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Cardamon,anyone? <br />
<br />
I'm holding a bottle of cooking cardamon powder on one hand and spraying English Fern on my other hand. Unless I mixed two bottles (you never know what could happen when you inhale so much alcohol), there is an unmistakably cardamon at top. Then it drops to a rubbery base.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="865073"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=865073#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent845700" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc845700" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Florista"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/938907"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.938907.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Florista" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Iris-Silver-Mist-1281.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1281.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Iris Silver Mist"title="Iris Silver Mist"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma845700ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd845700" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/938907">Florista</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-07-28">07/28/17 04:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My husband just started wearing this and it's somewhat surprising since he has a major distaste for typical men's scents along the lines of Brut and Polo.  But as mentioned by others, even though English Fern is a classic fougere, it's resemblence to modern lavender/oakmoss combos is very vague.  The simplicity of this formula really let's the medicinal character of the lavender, patchouli, and oakmoss create an overall feel of an early 20th century barbershop tonic rather than a generic 70's aftershave.  In fact, before I looked it up on this site, I wasn't even certain it was a fougere.  The scent opens vivid and green with depth and distinguishable notes in flight.  The drydown, in contrast, is fuzzy, clean and two dimensional. The oakmoss accord is so strong and dusty that you must love the smell of antique shops and old furniture to be open to loving English Fern.  On his skin, I am taken back to a bedroom filled with antiques that I used to occupy when visiting my great grandparents as a kid.  It smells of a combination of aging wood and remnants of cosmetics and soaps used long ago.  Very comforting but definitely not for everyone.   Eventually the lavender pops back up dried and familiar and English Fern, at it's most classic fougere-like, stays close to the skin...dapper but laid-back.  "Throwaway Chic" as Cary Grant called it.  Great choice for an everyday, goes-with-everything, polite men's fragrance and a surprise to anyone who thought they hated fougeres.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="845700"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=845700#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent792816" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc792816" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MountainviewK"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1046551"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="MountainviewK" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Geo-F-Trumper/Curzon-Cologne-4998.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4998.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Curzon Cologne"title="Curzon Cologne"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma792816ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd792816" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1046551">MountainviewK</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-02-14">02/14/17 20:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Recently got a set of samples from Trumper and Penhaligon. This is almost identical to Trumper's Wild Fern, with perhaps a couple of small differences. The Trumper is a bit softer, with less sillage and projection. On the other hand, Wild Fern is probably a little more nuanced, since it seems like there is a just bit more going on in terms of the notes involved. But these are both very similar, mainly lavender and oakmoss, and I doubt someone could tell the difference unless they were applied side by side, if then.<br />
<br />
Neither lasts very long on my skin but both are pleasant. They might both, and particularly the Trumper, be better viewed as great after shaves than all day colognes. <br />
<br />
Aside from what it smells like, English Fern (and Wild Fern) are interesting from an historical standpoint. Houbigant's Fougere Royale began the fougere fragrance family, now one of the largest. Modern representations are Brut, Clubman, Polo Green and the list goes on. Curious to know whether the current offering by Houbigant was faithful to the original, I learned in going through the reviews of that fragrance that the answer is 'no'. But at least one of the reviewers, who apparently had some experience with the original, suggested that the closest modern representation might be English Fern. <br />
<br />
Very interesting and probably true since Fougere Royale came out in 1882 and Trumper's Wild Fern came out in 1887. No doubt Trumper modeled his offering after the French one. And, as I say, English Fern, which itself came out in 1911, has almost the same profile as the Trumper cologne. Fun to connect the dots. <br />
<br />
Also fun to see just how much fougeres have changed; there is a big difference between English Fern and, say, Brut (or any other modern fougere for that matter, including the current Fougere Royale; I have a sample and indeed it smells nothing like either the Trumper or Penhaligon). How to summarize the difference between these original fougeres and the modern ones? At the risk of dumbing it down too much, the originals were much lighter and simpler. <br />
<br />
But enough history. Getting back to the fragrance, English Fern is a solid like for me but not a love given the longevity shortcomings.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="792816"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=792816#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent763539" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc763539" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="muzzbait"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/376302"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.376302.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="muzzbait" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Apoteker-Tepe/The-Peradam-33605.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.33605.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Peradam"title="The Peradam"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma763539ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd763539" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/376302">muzzbait</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-11-22">11/22/16 15:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>for me, fougeres more often than not remind me of my dad's aftershave all through my childhood. this scent, along with basically all fougeres, smell like my dad's aftershave, and as such, i canNOT fully appreciate them as it smells generic. not that it's generic, just that that lavender/oakmoss accord reminds me of trying to shave at age 14 and soaking my raw skin in aftershave. it's nice and pleasant, but it's totally not for me...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="763539"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=763539#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent749220" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc749220" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="F2097"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1009212"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="F2097" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma749220ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd749220" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1009212">F2097</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-10-05">10/05/16 05:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's soapy, spicy, masculine and I adore it. English Fern is also one of the strongest perfumes I've ever used.<br />
<br />
A single spray is enough for a cloud of English Fern to form around you. This isn't a subtle fragrance. I think for some it may be too much. I don't find I ever get sick of it though. <br />
<br />
Although a few other comments have mentioned it fades, I haven't found this. Every time I get at least 6 hours out of it.<br />
<br />
Penhaligon's have annoyingly discontinued the soap version. Shame as it was the best of their other products.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="749220"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=749220#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent733713" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc733713" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Gigi The Fashionista"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/951288"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.951288.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Gigi The Fashionista" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Fragonard/Violette-14299.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14299.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Violette"title="Violette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma733713ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd733713" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/951288">Gigi The Fashionista</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-08-18">08/18/16 05:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Fragrance Review For English Fern<br />
<br />
By Penhaligon<br />
<br />
Top Notes<br />
<br />
Lavender Geranium <br />
<br />
Middle Notes<br />
<br />
Cloves<br />
<br />
Base Notes <br />
<br />
Oak Moss Sandalwood Patchouli <br />
<br />
English Fern is a lovely little fougere. I adore fougeres and wish they could make more of them. The last fougere that I experienced was Chanel Boy. This is something like that. However, in defense of this perfume, it's from the Victorian Era and precedes modern perfume when lavender based fougeres were still very common. It's a bit like Royal Fougere by Houbigant.<br />
<br />
It's a delicate floral with oak moss and patchouli, cloves, and floral touches of lavender and geranium. Following the traditional make-up of a fougere, it has a lavender top note. You can really smell that lavender too. It's spicy, herbal, pastoral, like smelling lavender fields in the country. The cloves are also there from the start because their own earthy spiciness matches up with lavender. It smells minty and green just like putting your nose to actual green fern. It is outstanding how they recreated the scent of fern without using a fern note. <br />
<br />
The cloves dominate the scent at one point. It's like having slept in a little English garden with lavender and fern. The cloves are pretty powerful here and they welcome the unisex portion of the fragrance. Patchouli has long been considered a "masculine" aroma despite it's necessity in base notes for any perfume designed for men or women. The patchouli here is traditional patchouli and it's rather herbal and green, aromatic, spicy. It's not an incense based patchouli. It's very realistic to patchouli.  <br />
<br />
The sandalwood is heady and even a bit sweet. It's also very true to the scent of actual sandalwood. This fragrance was made using real extracts and oils so you don't get to smell the chemical carnivals of today's perfumes. There might be a degree of chemistry going on in this perfume but to me it smells like they did their best to honor the original which would have been pure lavender and patchouli oil. <br />
<br />
Absolutely beautiful. It's a fragrance of green hues and smells like leprechauns, the hills of Ireland and English gardens. This could pass for one of the English Lavender by Yardley type of scents. This is no nonsense, floral and green.  This fragrance seems suitable to be worn by herbalists, botanists, and florists, but it can be worn by mature ladies who enjoy lavender scents, or by men who like fougeres or floral guy scents (i.e. Green Irish Tweed). <br />
<br />
Gorgeous and green.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="733713"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=733713#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent717580" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc717580" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Taliera"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/4533"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.4533.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Taliera" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Voyage-Royal/The-Two-Roses-70560.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70560.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Two Roses"title="The Two Roses"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma717580ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd717580" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/4533">Taliera</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-06-23">06/23/16 20:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For a moment you're like... this is quite nice, then... No... just no.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="717580"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=717580#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent702353" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc702353" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="FlirtBoy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/87229"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.87229.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="FlirtBoy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Calvin-Klein/Eternity-For-Men-258.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.258.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eternity For Men"title="Eternity For Men"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma702353ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd702353" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/87229">FlirtBoy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-05-04">05/04/16 07:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sharp and soapy "old-school" lavender with almost moderate longevity and sillage. Not bad but way too "vintage". This is stuck too much in the Victorian Era... 6,75/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="702353"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=702353#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent668949" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc668949" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Fhaldara"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/207962"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.207962.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Fhaldara" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Prada/Infusion-de-Mimosa-38347.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.38347.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Infusion de Mimosa"title="Infusion de Mimosa"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma668949ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd668949" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/207962">Fhaldara</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-01-19">01/19/16 22:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's clean, green(ish) and very wearable, but I don't find it outstanding, especially for the price. I'll certainly finish my sample, but unless further testing reveals something I've so far missed I won't be purchasing a FB. In my opinion there are other fragrances out there that give you the same thing at much lower prices.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="668949"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=668949#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent637330" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
