It always gets compared to Wild Fern, which I have a bottle of and I have to say after trying English Fern, they are similar but English Fern seems to have a little more projection and a lot more longevity. It's going on 9 hours and I still can detect it on my wrist.  Looks like I bought the wrong Fern!  Oh well, can't win them all. My rating 7.0</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="595935"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=595935#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent588485" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc588485" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Pianomelody"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/775391"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.775391.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Pianomelody" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Bapteme-du-Feu-39436.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.39436.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Baptême du Feu"title="Baptême du Feu"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma588485ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd588485" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/775391">Pianomelody</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-04-23">04/23/15 10:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Clean, fresh, versatility .. .. English !! :)<br />
A good perfume suitable for spring, fresh atmosphere, English, aromatic ... is not among my favorites of Penhaligon's but not bad .. if you are looking for a very clean scent, reminiscent of the English countryside, the grass , the earth .. then you can play it safe with this. The Sillage is moderate, and longevity lasts about 8 hours on my skin. When I tried it on paper did not give me a very good impression .. but now that I've tried on the skin is a really good clean, fresh scent. Council for spring!<br />
<br />
Sillage: 6.5 / 10<br />
Longevity: 7.5/10<br />
Scent: 7/10<br />
<br />
Overall: 7/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="588485"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=588485#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent565950" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc565950" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Errol the Flynn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/700054"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Errol the Flynn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Atkinsons/The-British-Bouquet-18972.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18972.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The British Bouquet"title="The British Bouquet"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma565950ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd565950" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/700054">Errol the Flynn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-02-06">02/06/15 13:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>English fern by Penhaligons is a classic Gentleman's scent. Smells just like a traditional barbershop shave soap. Very soapy and extremely pleasant and relaxing smell. There seems to be a strong underlying scent of aniseed. I don't really get any other ingredients on my nose. I could certainly imagine John Steed of the Avengers wearing this fragrance.  Bronnley  English fern cologne certainly has a very similar smell for a fraction of the price of the Penhaligons. Longevity is not more than 2 hours on me unlike Penhaligon's Hamman which is relentless. Would I buy again? At £85 a pop for 100 ml I would definitely plump for the Bronnley 240ml cologne at £12.00. Mrs Peel would never know the difference!!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="565950"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=565950#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent554222" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc554222" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PGHChris"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/860352"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.860352.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PGHChris" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Montale/Aoud-Leather-9224.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9224.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aoud Leather"title="Aoud Leather"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma554222ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd554222" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/860352">PGHChris</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-12-31">12/31/14 17:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I must say, I was surprised by this fragrance. I picked up all the notes that are listed, but I also get a good dose of anise (which might be part of the [now synthetic] oakmoss). I was not expecting this to call to mind YSL Rive Gauche PH, or Azzaro PH, but it does for me. English Fern is much brighter, and better suited to warmer weather than those two, but they haunt my mind when I take this in. This is a great gentleman's scent, and I would highly reccomend this to anyone who enjoys Azzaro PH or Rive Gauche.  All around good stuff!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="554222"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=554222#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent532985" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc532985" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ParfumFetiche"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/612959"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.612959.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ParfumFetiche" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lush/Salarium-56382.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.56382.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Salarium"title="Salarium"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma532985ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd532985" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/612959">ParfumFetiche</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-10-18">10/18/14 00:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>On my skin and to my nose, I pick up mostly clover, lavender, geranium and oakmoss. It gives the impression of freshly washed warm skin and it's really a skin scent that wears close to the skin. Longevity is moderate on my skin. All in all, it's green, fresh and soapy, perfect for a day out in the sun. IMO, I would say it's a better alternative to aquatics.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="532985"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=532985#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent511995" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc511995" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Redbeard"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/537021"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.537021.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Redbeard" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma511995ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd511995" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/537021">Redbeard</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-08-09">08/09/14 08:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A very cool, crisp opening with lots of wintergreen (or whatever stuff always smells like WG to me), perhaps eucalyptus, and a bit of lemon. It's bigger, badder, and louder than Trumper's Wild Fern, for those who find their take on this theme to be too weak or mild-mannered. A stale pissy aura (to me at least) deep in the base makes me wary, though. This genre always reminds me of the flavor ingredients in cola, or something like anise or licorice, so I would never buy it, but if you like this scent family, the Penhaligon's is decent and it's got some major balls.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="511995"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=511995#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent479370" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc479370" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="avalon88"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/779416"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.779416.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="avalon88" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Acqua-di-Parma/Colonia-Intensa-1684.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1684.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Colonia Intensa"title="Colonia Intensa"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma479370ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd479370" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/779416">avalon88</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-04-25">04/25/14 03:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Manly, distinctive, it smells of class and good taste.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="479370"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=479370#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent452432" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc452432" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Roge"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/431088"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.431088.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Roge" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma452432ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd452432" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/431088">Roge</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-02-01">02/01/14 06:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>To start, English Fern is a wild boy...or maybe girl(which im still tryna figure out). Crack open your sample vial or bottle, dab or spray on skin, count to 15.....say bye bye lavender. That's how long that note lasts. I'll be Captain Hindsight for today and give you the "real" lowdown to what this really smells like. This smells like 2 things: Some sort of organic hair grease and/or female aftershave(if ever invented). In closing, the lavender is squeaky clean but lasts seconds. Oakmoss, Patchouli, mixed with cloves gives the woody/organic hair grease smell. Later down the line it goes back to fresh and bright. Not bad, not great...it's alright.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="452432"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=452432#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent427152" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc427152" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mousemousecat"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/447773"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="mousemousecat" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Toilette-3956.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3956.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tam Dao Eau de Toilette"title="Tam Dao Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma427152ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd427152" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/447773">mousemousecat</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-11-17">11/17/13 02:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>strepsils menthol flavour</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="427152"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=427152#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent362110" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc362110" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="malcner"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/451142"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="malcner" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma362110ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd362110" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/451142">malcner</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-05-02">05/02/13 02:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Like it's mentioned below, first impressions are of bushes/leaves and it's exactly what I was expecting with a name like English Fern. It's fresh and outdoorsy, very green and soapy. Not a lot of difference in the dry down, its very linear. It's quite nice, but I have to say I find it a but much. I mean, I wore it to work yesterday and on the train I was a bit self conscious of the fact that I stank of bushes. <br />
It's very accurate in what it advertises with the name, and the scent does remind me of playing in the woods when I was younger, which is nice. But, I couldn't help but get an overall impression of air freshener when I wore it. <br />
Projection seemed pretty good and longevity was average for penhaligon's, a few hours. Like I said, I was hoping it would dry down to something more mellow, but that initial burst of sharp, soapy greens doesn't go away for ages and, for me, it became a bit overpowering. Maybe I just wore too much....?<br />
HOWEVER, I wore terre d'hermes today and the smell of English Fern was still lingering on my blazer....I have to say I think these work great together and I would definitely consider buying a small bottle of English Fern, applying a small amount, and them teaming it up with a spray of terre d'hermes! Lovely! <br />
I think the trick is not to overdo the sprays/splashes!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="362110"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=362110#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent309409" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/198518">40plus&amp;fab</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-12-02">12/02/12 07:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Im going throuhg my samples from Penhaligon's. This to my nose, at first sniff I said "Wow, the name English Fern is sooo appropriate". Green (not grass but fresh bushes/leaves), earthy, clean and soapy. This definately brings to mind an old world English gentleman's smelling scent . . . unisex scent often work on my skin but I can't see this being unisex . . . maybe aftershave??</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="308079"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=308079#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent298072" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
