It starts fresh and stays that way comparing with my older bottle which is stronger and with medicine smell. The new one is watered down more unisex. I prefer the old one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="298072"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=298072#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent249013" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc249013" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alfarom"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/37900"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.37900.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="alfarom" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Gris-Clair-593.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.593.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gris Clair"title="Gris Clair"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma249013ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd249013" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/37900">alfarom</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-05-08">05/08/12 11:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don't know if something happened to English Fern but, the 2012 sample I'm smelling is awful. Maybe, recent severe restrictions on ingredients have strongly affected this composition but, as a matter of fact English Fern smells incredibly wrong and unbalanced. A classic fougere with lavender, oakmoss and the usual coumarin note that's so badly executed to result way too sharp and definitely unpleasant.<br />
<br />
Fougere is quite a crowded territory in which you can have plenty of better options at any price. Avoid.<br />
<br />
Rating: 4/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="249013"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=249013#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent156911" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc156911" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SoftWhispers"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/36031"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="SoftWhispers" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Royall-Lyme-Bermuda/Royall-Muske-5390.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5390.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Royall Muske"title="Royall Muske"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma156911ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd156911" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/36031">SoftWhispers</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-06-14">06/14/11 18:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I am very surprised by the ingredient listing "Cloves" rather than "Clover" as English Fern's Middle Note!  Although "Cloves" sounds like it might be an interesting addition to a Fougere, clover, hay or coumarin notes are what you would normally expect from this scent category and "Clover" is indeed what Penhaligon's lists as it's Middle or Heart notes in their "English Fern" cologne!  Either way, it's a favorite of mine and my very first Penhaligon's purchase from the Covent Garden store!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="156911"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=156911#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent127665" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc127665" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="weegee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/11063"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.11063.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="weegee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/La-Couche-du-Diable-55547.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55547.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Couche du Diable"title="La Couche du Diable"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma127665ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd127665" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/11063">weegee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-02-14">02/14/11 12:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>2 hours and phhhht! all gone.  Lovely while it lasted, especially because of the sharp contrast between the expectation of ferns and the surprise of cloves suddenly slapped onto a lavender bouquet.<br />
<br />
Historically interesting (men wore this in 1911?), perfectly "nice", but utterly, utterly ordinary.  And at this price point there are so many to choose from it's hard to imagine anyone choosing this over, say, Eau Sauvage, if it's the green lightness of ferns you're looking for.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="127665"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=127665#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent111564" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc111564" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gypsy parfumista"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/16449"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.16449.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gypsy parfumista" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/House-of-Matriarch/Fitnessence-31063.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31063.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fitnessence"title="Fitnessence"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma111564ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd111564" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/16449">gypsy parfumista</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-11-19">11/19/10 11:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>English Fern is not what I expected at all...it is green, very green and clean. It is not soft and fern-y, but it does have the English gentleman thing going on for sure. This could have been called English Lavender and Fern...<br />
<br />
Considering this was created in 1911 (before household electricity was en vogue) it is pretty impressive! This scent begins with a lot of lavender and geraniums...very manly yet floral at the same time. Geraniums are dry and kinda spicy, and the lavender is powdery and woody green, very aromatic-very English. The heart smooths and warms with the addition of the cloves' dry sweetness. The body of this does get a little less soapy, as the cloves surpass the flowers, but then it is a spicy green-still not really ferny. The ultimate finish is very dry woody and earthy. Moss mostly, some sweet dry sandal and just an whisper of patchouli. This has the "greenness" of fern leaves, the warmth of fern and an earthy finish, like where a fern would grow, but really isn't all that much like the smell of an actual fern plant; but I still love it! Penhaligon's has described the fern with every possible imaginable note; except, ironically ferns themselves, interesting...<br />
<br />
Sillage: great<br />
Longevity: very good<br />
Overall: 3.5/5<br />
<br />
This smells to me of a walk in the English countryside, perhaps even a horseback ride; then a shower outside in one of those old wooden showers with a natural homemade soap and then dried off with a linen towel and splash on some vintage eau de cologne and sit down to a dinner of bangers and mash and, perhaps a bit of plum pudding for dessert. ENGLAND, through and through...This is most likely what Heathcliffe from Wuthering Heights smelled like (and Catherine most likely Bluebell OR Lily and Spice...)-very masculine and simple, yet fine and clean in a very outdoorsy natural  way. Over the wily, windy moors...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="111564"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=111564#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent106878" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc106878" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Dick Turpin Esq"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/14862"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.14862.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Dick Turpin Esq" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Cartier/Declaration-307.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.307.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Declaration"title="Declaration"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma106878ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd106878" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/14862">Dick Turpin Esq</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-10-21">10/21/10 16:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I would like, if I may, to take you on a strange journey. Dr Jekyll was performing his usual morally apathetic and anatomically risky science experiments, mixing headache inducing quantities of Geranium with overbearing Victorian Clove mouthwash he had stolen from the vile dental training hospital.<br />
<br />
He fortifed the noxious elixir with some old Tar kitchen soap cream called “swarfega” (made in Derbyshire England), which is a dark green, gelatinous, thixotropic substance used to clean grease, oil, printer's ink, or hydrophobic dirt off the skin when he’d been working on his new fangled motor car (which none the less, always left his fingernails disconcertingly filthy).<br />
<br />
He inhaled this brutish crude concoction and proceeded to smear it on his jowls. The diabolical change was immediate; animalistic hair growth on his cheeks, his voice rasping as if for clean air, eye’s burning  with toxicity and his whole persona transformed into the peculiar case of Mr Hyde. Too much Geranium his brain screamed! Oakmoss is too Obvious! Why did I add Patchouli and not ANY FERN! These Cloves are Killing my brain cells! Snarling and in a fury at the suffocating green reek on his cheeks and jowls, he fled into the night seeking to spread violence and vice, in a haze of English Fern induced psychosis.<br />
<br />
I myself have since tried Dr Jekyll formulation which he evidently bestowed on Mr Penhaligon, as even the smallest vial of this substance, was so distressing to me that I felt only steel wool would remove the odour, such is its primitive formulation, poor balance and jarring notes.<br />
<br />
Should you really want to smell as if you were a Victorian gentleman and felt that your fragrance choices were limited to either, lemons, sandalwood, horse manure or English fern, I would recommend Trumper’s which actually does justice to the fougere.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="106878"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=106878#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent104120" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc104120" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jaro"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/32903"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="jaro" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Oriza-L-Legrand/Scotch-Lavender-65091.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.65091.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Scotch Lavender"title="Scotch Lavender"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma104120ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd104120" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/32903">jaro</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-10-05">10/05/10 08:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The first time I smelled Penhaligon's English Fern, I thought some wizzard had transported me in a forest, just after the rain. It smells of the earth, of wet grass, of crushed lavender and clover flowers...irresistible!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="104120"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=104120#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent102199" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc102199" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Dad jax"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/29717"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.29717.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Dad jax" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Issey-Miyake/L-Eau-d-Issey-Pour-Homme-Noir-Absolu-10075.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10075.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L’Eau d’Issey Pour Homme Noir Absolu"title="L’Eau d’Issey Pour Homme Noir Absolu"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma102199ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd102199" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/29717">Dad jax</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-09-24">09/24/10 11:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Hahaha ppl open your eyes and look at it, it is an Aftershave..haha lol...by mistake they gave this pic here and every one started commentigs..haha lol</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="102199"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=102199#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent86182" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc86182" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mimmi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/16869"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.16869.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mimmi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Alexander-McQueen/Kingdom-1195.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1195.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Kingdom"title="Kingdom"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma86182ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd86182" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/16869">Mimmi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-06-20">06/20/10 08:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Most of these notes are favourites of mine - I just wasnt expecting them to come together in a bottle called "English Fern". A slightly bitter note; geranium, keeps the lavender and clove fresh and safe from getting sharp or too sweet. Refreshing, light with an upcoming powdery whiff from sandal, and a grounding body from the lovely moss. This works well with my chemistry and makes an ideal scent after a hot day - be it from outer or inner high pressure. Id like to have this scent, the showerceam, the bodycream and a coctail to drink of it!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="86182"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=86182#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent48355" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc48355" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MirabelleJee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/9960"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.9960.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MirabelleJee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mancera/Aoud-Lemon-Mint-39181.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.39181.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aoud Lemon Mint"title="Aoud Lemon Mint"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma48355ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd48355" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/9960">MirabelleJee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2009-10-03">10/03/09 09:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I will be repeating the previous reviews, but I'll say that it's soapy. For me it's more man's, but I feel comfortable in it too. Not too bitter, not too grassy, a bit sour and citrusy. As noble as the other Penhaligon's scents.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="48355"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=48355#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent48076" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc48076" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Pan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/11853"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Pan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/James-Heeley/Cardinal-7844.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.7844.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cardinal"title="Cardinal"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma48076ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd48076" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/11853">Pan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2009-09-30">09/30/09 20:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really agree with DawnLady3 about the expectation about English Fern, which should be green. However, it is definitely SOAPY, which comes from the lavender. And I don't usually like lavender. As time goes by, it smells very soapy and white flowery. The base note, which I always love, is not quiet but a little out due to the pachouli in it. Overall, it is not bad, and I do like it. Though I expected to be a green one, so a little bit disappointed.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="48076"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=48076#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent26852" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc26852" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="DawnLady3"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/5372"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.5372.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="DawnLady3" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Narciso-Rodriguez/Narciso-Poudree-36679.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.36679.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Narciso Poudree"title="Narciso Poudree"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma26852ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd26852" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/5372">DawnLady3</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2009-03-20">03/20/09 01:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This one surprised me a little.  With a name like English Fern, I was expecting it to be very green and possibly a bit dull, but it opens bright and sharp, with the lavender dominant.  It also smells a little of citrus to me, though no citrus notes are listed.  With time the sharpness subsides, and it becomes softer, slightly powdery and soapy, and much more feminine than I expected, with the lavender present throughout.  This lasted much longer on me than most Penhaligon's do.  I don't usually like sharp or green or lavender-based fragrances, but overall I liked this one much more than I expected to.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="26852"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=26852#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent26452" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc26452" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="coco76"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2287"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2287.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="coco76" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Kyse-Perfumes/Oui-Plus-31480.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31480.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oui Plus"title="Oui Plus"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma26452ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd26452" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2287">coco76</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2009-03-15">03/15/09 17:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Oakmoss (for me) is a tricky, tricky, note. At times it can give a perfume a smoothness, and other times it is overbearing and entirely too masculine for my tastes. This is one of those instances...unfortunately this smells stuffy and obtrusive, screaming with its scent. Too heavy and overtly masculine for me...i'm not even sure i'd like this on a man.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="26452"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=26452#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent17538" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc17538" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dacha"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/6224"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="dacha" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Le-Lion-Eau-de-Parfum-61036.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.61036.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Le Lion Eau de Parfum"title="Le Lion Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma17538ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd17538" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/6224">dacha</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2008-12-26">12/26/08 18:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For me this is redolent of the scents from a lost childhood in the English  countryside, along with Quercus and Bluebell. sadly with all of them after a big opening they fade quickly. I do love them but they just don't last on my skin, 4 hrs at most.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="17538"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=17538#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent3576" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc3576" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Aiona"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/844"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.844.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Aiona" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Hypnotic-Poison-219.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.219.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Hypnotic Poison"title="Hypnotic Poison"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma3576ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd3576" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/844">Aiona</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2008-07-03">07/03/08 23:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Soapy!  I like it!  It doesn't seem unisex at first, but after about an hour, I feel more comfortable in it, because it's just so-PAY!  I'm guessing it's the lavender making it soapy.  LONG-lasting.  Lasted all day, with just one spray.  All-day, one-spray, soapy!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="3576"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=3576#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                    </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-positive-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Positive Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent1097814" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1097814" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jerry Can"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/785126"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.785126.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jerry Can" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1097814ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1097814" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/785126">Jerry Can</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-09-15">09/15/19 03:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>There are NO cloves in English Fern. The middle note is CLOVER.<br />
<br />
English Fern is a beautiful fougère. Initially there is a curious medicinal air. But that soon passes. For me it's like indulging in a deeply filled hot bath with an expensive soap. Lavender, geranium and clover make for an aura of soapy cleanliness and to me is reminiscent of chamomile. The oakmoss, patchouli and sandalwood add an unintrusive background earthiness. It does feel very Edwardian English.<br />
<br />
Long lasting and having good projection, I'd suggest light application in the first instance. English Fern is described as a scent for men and women. Curious then that the decal should include the words 'after-shave'. There is nothing effeminate here despite its appeal to men and women. Inspires plenty of interest when I wear it. And it isn't hard to discern why — being effortlessly classy even if in a slightly old-fashioned way.<br />
<br />
The longevity alone makes for a good choice as a daytime scent. I've also been known to apply it to my palms before lights-out finding it a perfect way to a good nights sleep.<br />
<br />
Reminds me possibly of D&amp;G Pour Homme, but without the citrus.<br />
<br />
I've heard it rumoured it might be discontinued in 2020. I hope that's wrong. For a composition dating from 1890 to get withdrawn now would be a sort of cultural vandalism.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="1097814"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=1097814#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent111564" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc111564" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gypsy parfumista"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/16449"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.16449.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gypsy parfumista" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/House-of-Matriarch/Fitnessence-31063.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31063.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fitnessence"title="Fitnessence"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma111564ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd111564" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/16449">gypsy parfumista</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-11-19">11/19/10 11:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>English Fern is not what I expected at all...it is green, very green and clean. It is not soft and fern-y, but it does have the English gentleman thing going on for sure. This could have been called English Lavender and Fern...<br />
<br />
Considering this was created in 1911 (before household electricity was en vogue) it is pretty impressive! This scent begins with a lot of lavender and geraniums...very manly yet floral at the same time. Geraniums are dry and kinda spicy, and the lavender is powdery and woody green, very aromatic-very English. The heart smooths and warms with the addition of the cloves' dry sweetness. The body of this does get a little less soapy, as the cloves surpass the flowers, but then it is a spicy green-still not really ferny. The ultimate finish is very dry woody and earthy. Moss mostly, some sweet dry sandal and just an whisper of patchouli. This has the "greenness" of fern leaves, the warmth of fern and an earthy finish, like where a fern would grow, but really isn't all that much like the smell of an actual fern plant; but I still love it! Penhaligon's has described the fern with every possible imaginable note; except, ironically ferns themselves, interesting...<br />
<br />
Sillage: great<br />
Longevity: very good<br />
Overall: 3.5/5<br />
<br />
This smells to me of a walk in the English countryside, perhaps even a horseback ride; then a shower outside in one of those old wooden showers with a natural homemade soap and then dried off with a linen towel and splash on some vintage eau de cologne and sit down to a dinner of bangers and mash and, perhaps a bit of plum pudding for dessert. ENGLAND, through and through...This is most likely what Heathcliffe from Wuthering Heights smelled like (and Catherine most likely Bluebell OR Lily and Spice...)-very masculine and simple, yet fine and clean in a very outdoorsy natural  way. Over the wily, windy moors...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="111564"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=111564#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent792816" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc792816" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MountainviewK"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1046551"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="MountainviewK" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Geo-F-Trumper/Curzon-Cologne-4998.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4998.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Curzon Cologne"title="Curzon Cologne"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma792816ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd792816" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1046551">MountainviewK</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-02-14">02/14/17 20:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Recently got a set of samples from Trumper and Penhaligon. This is almost identical to Trumper's Wild Fern, with perhaps a couple of small differences. The Trumper is a bit softer, with less sillage and projection. On the other hand, Wild Fern is probably a little more nuanced, since it seems like there is a just bit more going on in terms of the notes involved. But these are both very similar, mainly lavender and oakmoss, and I doubt someone could tell the difference unless they were applied side by side, if then.<br />
<br />
Neither lasts very long on my skin but both are pleasant. They might both, and particularly the Trumper, be better viewed as great after shaves than all day colognes. <br />
<br />
Aside from what it smells like, English Fern (and Wild Fern) are interesting from an historical standpoint. Houbigant's Fougere Royale began the fougere fragrance family, now one of the largest. Modern representations are Brut, Clubman, Polo Green and the list goes on. Curious to know whether the current offering by Houbigant was faithful to the original, I learned in going through the reviews of that fragrance that the answer is 'no'. But at least one of the reviewers, who apparently had some experience with the original, suggested that the closest modern representation might be English Fern. <br />
<br />
Very interesting and probably true since Fougere Royale came out in 1882 and Trumper's Wild Fern came out in 1887. No doubt Trumper modeled his offering after the French one. And, as I say, English Fern, which itself came out in 1911, has almost the same profile as the Trumper cologne. Fun to connect the dots. <br />
<br />
Also fun to see just how much fougeres have changed; there is a big difference between English Fern and, say, Brut (or any other modern fougere for that matter, including the current Fougere Royale; I have a sample and indeed it smells nothing like either the Trumper or Penhaligon). How to summarize the difference between these original fougeres and the modern ones? At the risk of dumbing it down too much, the originals were much lighter and simpler. <br />
<br />
But enough history. Getting back to the fragrance, English Fern is a solid like for me but not a love given the longevity shortcomings.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="792816"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=792816#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1007281" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1007281" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tore"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1174520"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1174520.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tore" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tiziana-Terenzi/Foconero-44358.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.44358.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Foconero"title="Foconero"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1007281ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1007281" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1174520">Tore</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-12-06">12/06/18 07:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ok, this stuff is very green and inspiring, like a walk in a park after the rain. The grass is wet, and the air is so clean and piercing. The geranium is more noticeable than the lavender.<br />
There is something slightly sweet too, maybe some hint of anice, and yes, I feel the cardamome too. The performance is good. 9/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="1007281"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=1007281#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent127665" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc127665" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="weegee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/11063"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.11063.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="weegee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/La-Couche-du-Diable-55547.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55547.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Couche du Diable"title="La Couche du Diable"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma127665ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd127665" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/11063">weegee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-02-14">02/14/11 12:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>2 hours and phhhht! all gone.  Lovely while it lasted, especially because of the sharp contrast between the expectation of ferns and the surprise of cloves suddenly slapped onto a lavender bouquet.<br />
<br />
Historically interesting (men wore this in 1911?), perfectly "nice", but utterly, utterly ordinary.  And at this price point there are so many to choose from it's hard to imagine anyone choosing this over, say, Eau Sauvage, if it's the green lightness of ferns you're looking for.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="127665"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=127665#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="3939" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent106878" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc106878" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Dick Turpin Esq"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/14862"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.14862.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Dick Turpin Esq" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Cartier/Declaration-307.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.307.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Declaration"title="Declaration"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma106878ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd106878" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/14862">Dick Turpin Esq</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-10-21">10/21/10 16:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I would like, if I may, to take you on a strange journey. Dr Jekyll was performing his usual morally apathetic and anatomically risky science experiments, mixing headache inducing quantities of Geranium with overbearing Victorian Clove mouthwash he had stolen from the vile dental training hospital.<br />
<br />
He fortifed the noxious elixir with some old Tar kitchen soap cream called “swarfega” (made in Derbyshire England), which is a dark green, gelatinous, thixotropic substance used to clean grease, oil, printer's ink, or hydrophobic dirt off the skin when he’d been working on his new fangled motor car (which none the less, always left his fingernails disconcertingly filthy).<br />
<br />
He inhaled this brutish crude concoction and proceeded to smear it on his jowls. The diabolical change was immediate; animalistic hair growth on his cheeks, his voice rasping as if for clean air, eye’s burning  with toxicity and his whole persona transformed into the peculiar case of Mr Hyde. Too much Geranium his brain screamed! Oakmoss is too Obvious! Why did I add Patchouli and not ANY FERN! These Cloves are Killing my brain cells! Snarling and in a fury at the suffocating green reek on his cheeks and jowls, he fled into the night seeking to spread violence and vice, in a haze of English Fern induced psychosis.<br />
<br />
I myself have since tried Dr Jekyll formulation which he evidently bestowed on Mr Penhaligon, as even the smallest vial of this substance, was so distressing to me that I felt only steel wool would remove the odour, such is its primitive formulation, poor balance and jarring notes.<br />
<br />
Should you really want to smell as if you were a Victorian gentleman and felt that your fragrance choices were limited to either, lemons, sandalwood, horse manure or English fern, I would recommend Trumper’s which actually does justice to the fougere.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="106878"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=106878#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent249013" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc249013" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alfarom"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/37900"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.37900.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="alfarom" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Gris-Clair-593.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.593.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gris Clair"title="Gris Clair"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma249013ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd249013" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/37900">alfarom</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-05-08">05/08/12 11:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don't know if something happened to English Fern but, the 2012 sample I'm smelling is awful. Maybe, recent severe restrictions on ingredients have strongly affected this composition but, as a matter of fact English Fern smells incredibly wrong and unbalanced. A classic fougere with lavender, oakmoss and the usual coumarin note that's so badly executed to result way too sharp and definitely unpleasant.<br />
<br />
Fougere is quite a crowded territory in which you can have plenty of better options at any price. Avoid.<br />
<br />
Rating: 4/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="249013"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=249013#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent309409" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc309409" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="40plus&amp;fab"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/198518"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.198518.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="40plus&amp;fab" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Montale/Chypre-Fruite-3756.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3756.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chypre Fruite"title="Chypre Fruite"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma309409ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd309409" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/198518">40plus&amp;fab</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-12-02">12/02/12 07:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Im going throuhg my samples from Penhaligon's. This to my nose, at first sniff I said "Wow, the name English Fern is sooo appropriate". Green (not grass but fresh bushes/leaves), earthy, clean and soapy. This definately brings to mind an old world English gentleman's smelling scent . . . unisex scent often work on my skin but I can't see this being unisex . . . maybe aftershave??</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="309409"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=309409#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent511995" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc511995" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Redbeard"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/537021"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.537021.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Redbeard" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma511995ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd511995" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/537021">Redbeard</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-08-09">08/09/14 08:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A very cool, crisp opening with lots of wintergreen (or whatever stuff always smells like WG to me), perhaps eucalyptus, and a bit of lemon. It's bigger, badder, and louder than Trumper's Wild Fern, for those who find their take on this theme to be too weak or mild-mannered. A stale pissy aura (to me at least) deep in the base makes me wary, though. This genre always reminds me of the flavor ingredients in cola, or something like anise or licorice, so I would never buy it, but if you like this scent family, the Penhaligon's is decent and it's got some major balls.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="511995"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=511995#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent965306" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc965306" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="echo4kilo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1153785"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1153785.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="echo4kilo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/FZOTIC/Room-237-30364.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.30364.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Room 237"title="Room 237"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma965306ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd965306" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1153785">echo4kilo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-07-25">07/25/18 11:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I got a sample of this from Luckyscent. I really like Penhaligan's Sartorial and wanted to try other fragrances. English Fern has a noticeable licorice smell at first. After a few minutes it has a smell similar to, but inferior to Sartorial under the licorice. I'm glad I only got a sample.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3939"comment_id="965306"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/English-Fern-3939.html?ccid=965306#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="3939" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="search-reviews"><search-perfume-reviews :perfume_id="3939":random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]"></search-perfume-reviews></div></div><foundation-tabs></foundation-tabs></reviews-wrapper></div><perfume-shortcut-menu :perfume_id="3939" when-hidden="#toptop"></perfume-shortcut-menu><initialize-status-data></initialize-status-data><div class="cell small-12"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_footer -->
<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300 __728x90" id="fragranticacom_perfume_footer" v-pre>

        <div class="cell small-4 medium-2 flex-container flex-dir-column">
        <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 2.9em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">1.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 2; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/perfume/Lattafa-Perfumes/Khamrah-75805.html" class="en2inter">Khamrah Lattafa Perfumes</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 2.9em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">2.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 2; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/perfume/Jean-Paul-Gaultier/Le-Male-Elixir-81642.html" class="en2inter">Le Male Elixir Jean Paul Gaultier</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 2.9em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">3.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 2; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/perfume/By-Kilian/Angels-Share-62615.html" class="en2inter">Angels&#039; Share By Kilian</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 2.9em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">4.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 2; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">

        </span>
    </div>
            </div>
        <div class="cell small-4 medium-2 flex-container flex-dir-column">
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 2.9em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">5.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 2; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">

        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 2.9em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">6.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 2; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">

    </div>

        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">7.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 2; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">
            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/perfume/Giorgio-Armani/Emporio-Armani-Stronger-With-You-Intensely-52802.html" class="en2inter">Emporio Armani Stronger With You Intensely  Giorgio Armani</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 2.9em; overflow: hidden;">

    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFFe5cbbe5e5f689826b719ace22a5b2a11');
